paper_abstract: Say that Y has the strong random anticupping property if there is a set A such that for every Martin-Lof random set R Y <= (T)A circle plus R double right arrow Y <= R-T (in this case A is an anticupping witness for Y). Nies has shown that every random Delta(0)(2) set has the strong 2 random anticupping property via a promptly simple anticupping witness. We show that every Delta(0)(2) set has the 2 random anticupping property via a promptly simple anticupping witness. Moreover, we prove the following stronger statement: for every non-computable Y <= ((empty set))(T)' there exists a promptly simple A such that Y <= (T)A circle plus R double right arrow A <= R-T for all Martin-Lof random sets R.
